alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 8:38AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Columbia. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the base of the levee at the Columbia Park * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Saturday was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.4 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise to 17.5 feet Friday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 545 PM CDT.
